Bangladesh 109-7: Hridoy 37; Maharaj 3-27.
Keshav Maharaj took 3 wickets for 27 runs.
Heinrich Klaasen scored 46 runs for South Africa.
Towhid Hridoy scored 37 off 34 balls for Bangladesh.
Tanzim Hasan Sakib took three wickets for Bangladesh.
South Africa post 113-6: Klaasen 46, Miller 29; Tanzim 3-18.
David Miller was dropped on 13 and went on to score 29 runs.
Anrich Nortje and Kagiso Rabada struck twice for South Africa.
Proteas have won all three matches and are on brink of Super 8s.
Kagiso Rabada bowled a crucial 18th over, conceding only one run.
Keshav Maharaj took three wickets, including two in the final over.
South Africa hold on to beat Bangladesh by four runs in a thriller.
Taskin Ahmed was unable to score the required runs in the final over.
South Africa defeated Bangladesh by four runs in a final over thriller.
Mahmudullah and Towhid Hridoy put on a 44-run partnership for the fifth wicket.
Keshav Maharaj bowled the final over for the first time in T20Is and took two wickets.
Hridoy falls lbw to Rabada late on; Mahmudullah caught trying to hit six to win the match.
David Miller was dropped by Litton Das on 13, which could have been a turning point in the match.
Mahmudullah was controversially given out, negating four leg byes that could have forced a Super Over.
Aiden Markram took a stunning running catch at long-on to dismiss Mahmudullah, a pivotal moment in the match.
Keshav Maharaj defended 10 runs in the last over, including three full tosses, to secure a four-run win for South Africa.
Anrich Nortje finished his four overs with figures of 2 for 17, becoming one away from the joint leading wicket-taker at the tournament.
Tanzim Hasan took the key wickets of Reeza Hendricks, Quinton de Kock, and Tristan Stubbs, contributing significantly to Bangladesh's bowling effort.
